meanings.sent1: The snail can mucate to create a slimy trail.
meanings.sent2: When you have a cold, your nose may mucate more than usual.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally mucated into the soup instead of stirring.
meanings.sent4: The fountain seemed to mucate water endlessly, like a magical spring.
meanings.sent5: The tree seemed to mucate sap in the warm sunlight, glistening like jewels.

meanings.sent1: The mucate frog looked slippery and shiny.
meanings.sent2: The mucate tissues stuck to his fingers uncomfortably.
meanings.sent3: The mucate floor made the kids slip and slide like penguins.
meanings.sent4: The mucate walls of the cave glistened in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The mucate snail left a trail of slime wherever it went.
